de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.extraction

Class AuthorNameRecognition

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.extraction.AuthorNameRecognition

  • public class AuthorNameRecognition
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for the name recognition in a reference part The method recognizeNamesWithMatcher and recognizeNamesInCitation distinguish from the input. The recognizeNamesInCitation search in the single reference and the recognizeNamesWithMatcher method search in the plain text
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    loco

      • testAuthorPatterns

        public void testAuthorPatterns(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> lineTokens)
        Deprecated. cause some papers include a very heterogeneous style and the method fail. The recognizeNameWithMatcher method use in version 0.2 all pattern for the authorpart of a reference
        This method test each author pattern similar like testReferencePattern() But the tested Strings are the starts of a line, cause a author occurs at the beginning of a reference

      • recognizeNamesWithMatcher

        public void recognizeNamesWithMatcher(java.lang.String plainText,
                             java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> lineTokens,
                             java.lang.String autPartReg)
        This method find potential author names based on the author patterns and the author part pattern, which was generated by the templateBuilder.
        The author part matcher, which was generated with the author part pattern will find potentially substrings, which could include author names. Each matcher start at position 0 of the current found author part. If one matcher find something,the list of the customPatterns will sort by the MatchComparator. The matcher with the first match and the maximal length will use. A match is accepted, if it match at the start of a line or the distance between a previous match is smaller than a given threshold. The assumption is, that the author occurs in a neighborhood and not randomly.
      • check of the line beginning test work as following:
          use the (match.start()+authorpart.start()) to get the beginning position of the match in the text
          retrieve the line key of the line, which include the match string with the floorKey method of the "lineTokens" tree. If the difference between linekey and match.start is smaller than 2, it could be a potential name and is stored in the "nameTree" with the position in the reference part string
      • distance check:
          retrieve the previous match with the lowerKey method
          check the number of characters between the current match and the previous match
        • Each matcher start at the position after the current match position for the next match.
Parameters:
plainText - the current reference part
lineTokens - a map with the position of each line as key and the line as value
autPartReg - the author part regex to reduce the search space for the name matchers

  • recognizeNamesWithMatcher

    public void recognizeNamesWithMatcher(java.lang.String plainText)
    light version for name recognition in xml files, which are not tagged
